title: Luka on Harrison firing: Just focused on Lakers
content: Luka Doncic, asked for his reaction to the dismissal of the man who traded him from Dallas to Los Angeles, said he is "just trying to move on and focus on what I'm doing here."

title: WR Brown vents about offense, not sorry for stir
content: Hours after video surfaced of him saying things are "a s---show" outside of his family life, an unapologetic A.J. Brown said his discontent is with Philadelphia's offense as a whole, not his own situation.

title: Skubal gets repeat Cy Young; Skenes unanimous
content: Tigers ace Tarik Skubal became the first back-to-back Cy Young Award winner since Jacob deGrom (2018-19), while the Pirates' Paul Skenes won his first in the NL.

title: Irish star Hidalgo posts record 16 steals, 44 points
content: Notre Dame star Hannah Hidalgo set a school record with 44 points and broke the NCAA mark with 16 steals to lead the Fighting Irish in a rout of Akron.

title: Kidd urges outraged Mavs fans to 'move forward'
content: Mavericks head coach Jason Kidd urged fans to "move forward" after the firing of GM Nico Harrison and stressed that his players are playing hard and "trying to win."

title: Jokic puts up 55 to match SGA for season high
content: Nikola Jokic had 55 points, tying the highest-scoring performance in the NBA this season, as the Nuggets beat the Clippers on Wednesday night.

title: Brunson turns ankle, seen exiting MSG on crutches
content: Knicks star Jalen Brunson turned his right ankle on a drive to the basket with under two minutes remaining Wednesday night and was seen leaving Madison Square Garden in a walking boot and using crutches.

title: Curry's 46 gets Dubs back in groove after blowout
content: Coming off a "humbling" defeat to the Thunder, the Warriors regrouped and shuffled their starting lineup against the Spurs on Wednesday

title: MLB Awards Week predictions, results: Skenes, Skubal earn Cy Young Awards
content: Baseball's best are collecting their hardware this week. On Wednesday, it was a pair of aces from Pittsburgh and Detroit.

title: Why not Virginia? How Tony Elliott weathered tragedy and built a winner
content: The Virginia coach reflects on the personal and professional changes in his life three years after the shooting that killed three of his players.

title: Barnwell's early preview of the 2026 quarterback carousel: Which teams might need a new QB1?
content: Will Arizona move on from Kyler Murray? Is the Tua Tagovailoa era over in Miami? And has time already run out on Bryce Young in Carolina?

content: We listed the NFL's top 25 pending free agents and gave intel on who might return to their current team.

content: Five NFL teams have at least 5% odds to land the No. 1 pick in 2026, per our Football Power Index -- the Titans, Browns, Jets, Saints and Raiders.

content: ESPN's Football Power Index projects the draft order for Round 1. Which teams have the best odds to pick early?

content: After a long wait and a rough start, the Crimson Tide QB has his team poised for a national title bid.

content: The way voters see the MVP award has changed throughout MLB history. Here's how it might apply to 2025.

content: Victor Wembanyama and Stephon Castle are taking San Antonio to new heights this season on both ends of the floor.

content: From top-10 picks to late first-round draft steals, who are the top rookies that have impressed so far?

content: From Cathy Engelbert and Adam Silver to WNBA owners, here's what the management side of CBA negotiations is focused on.

content: After one month of the season, these 15 players have been better (or worse) than projected. Will it continue?

content: With three first-round picks in 2022, New York looked as if it were set up to turn around the franchise.

content: Where will Murray play next season? What's next for the Giants? Which 2026 free agents are worth watching? We have the latest.

content: Updated Power Rankings ahead of Week 11. Plus, we picked every team's MVP -- not including quarterbacks.

content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Jameson Williams and three other upside players to trade for
content: The trade deadline is coming, so we have players to target to get your roster ready for the fantasy playoffs.

title: UFC 322 preview: Where have all the champ-champs gone?
content: Nine years ago this weekend, Conor McGregor became the first fighter to hold two UFC belts simultaneously.

title: For the family of WWE legend Eddie Guerrero, his shadow still looms large
content: Twenty years after his death, the legendary WWE superstar still exists in the memories of his loved ones.

title: Luka Doncic trolled by teammates after dunk against Hornets
content: According to Basketball Reference, the dunk marked Luka Doncic's third slam in the past two seasons -- two with Los Angeles this season.

title: USC claps back after B1G said fake punt should've been penalized
content: The Big Ten said on Sunday that USC should've been penalized for the fake punt pass they executed last Friday.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Julius Randle leads the the Timberwolves in fantasy points
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from Julius Randle, Russell Westbrook and Andrew Nembhard in the months ahead.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool, Spurs tracking West Ham's Bowen
content: Liverpool and Tottenham Hotspur are looking at West Ham forward Jarrod Bowen. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: '32 vehicles with explosives': Agencies uncover chilling plot; details of Delhi blast case
content: Intelligence agencies have uncovered a wider terror plot linked to the Delhi Red Fort car explosion, revealing plans to rig 32 vehicles for coordinated attacks across multiple cities. Investigations revealed suspects were modifying vehicles and preparing to execute serial blasts with multiple IEDs, with eight suspects working in pairs assigned to specific cities.

title: 'B'desh-like uprising': RJD leader's shock remark on eve of Bihar poll results; FIR filed
content: Ahead of Bihar election results, RJD leader Sunil Singh was booked for an "inflammatory" remark, warning of Nepal-like unrest if candidates were "made to lose." This comes as exit polls predict a win for the NDA, with projections showing the Mahagathbandhan falling short of a majority. Police are on alert to prevent any untoward incidents.

title: H-1B debate heats up: US Treasury Secretary to Donald Trump; 'An American can’t have that job, not yet'
content: The Trump administration is repositioning the H-1B visa program for a "knowledge transfer" strategy, aiming to bring in skilled foreign workers to train Americans for high-tech roles. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent stated that overseas experts will work in the U.S. for several years to rebuild advanced manufacturing before domestic workers take over.

title: IPL: Mumbai Indians confirm Shardul Thakur's trade from LSG
content: Shardul Thakur is set to join Mumbai Indians for the 2026 IPL season, with the franchise officially confirming the trade from Lucknow Super Giants. This move marks Thakur's seventh IPL team. The announcement comes ahead of the player retention and release announcements scheduled for Saturday. Mumbai Indians will become the seventh IPL franchise that Shardul has represented.

title: Yunus powergrab? B'desh to hold referendum in Feb; what is July Charter?
content: Bangladesh's interim chief adviser Muhammad Yunus announced a national referendum on the "July Charter" for state reform will be held alongside parliamentary elections in February 2026. The charter, born from a student uprising, proposes significant institutional changes. This move occurs amidst heightened political tensions following former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's trial.

title: Dhoni or Kohli? Harmanpreet Kaur picks her favourite, crowd goes berserk - watch
content: Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur, fresh off leading India to their maiden ICC Women's Cricket World Cup title, revealed MS Dhoni as her favourite cricketer over Virat Kohli. Speaking to students, she also expressed her admiration for Virender Sehwag and pride in the growing recognition of women's cricket. India’s journey to the title was challenging.

title: Skip college join Palantir: Company offers internship; CEO calls it degree alternative
content: Palantir is launching a fellowship for recent high school graduates, positioning it as a direct alternative to traditional college. This program aims to cultivate talent by focusing on practical skills and building, challenging the conventional educational path. Participants engage in readings, debates, and guest lectures before taking on full-time roles, with some fellows already receiving job offers.

title: Employee skips meeting during leave: Boss disappointed; sparks debate on work culture
content: An Indian employee's resignation after being asked to attend a meeting on approved leave sparked widespread discussion.  This incident highlights a growing trend of work encroaching on personal time, with many professionals feeling pressured to be constantly available.  The article explores the toll of overcommitment culture and the emerging demand for better work-life balance and mutual respect.

title: 'Not every Kashmiri is a terrorist': J&K CM reacts to Delhi car blast probe
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah asserted that not all residents of the region are terrorists, following the Red Fort car blast probe widening to Kashmir. The investigation revealed a Turkiye-based handler, codenamed Ukasa, directed the module, which included professionals like doctors and a cleric who allegedly radicalized students.

title: Hack of the day: RBI UDGAM: How to find unclaimed money in your family
content: Discover unclaimed money in your family's name through the RBI's UDGAM portal. Simply use basic details like name and date of birth to search across numerous banks. If a match surfaces, reclaim your funds by visiting the bank with necessary documents. This initiative helps reunite individuals with forgotten deposits, ensuring rightful owners can access their money.

title: Vibe coding: Meta’s AI chief's advice for teens; 'spend time on this skill'
content: Meta's Chief AI Officer Alexandr Wang urges teenagers to master AI tools, comparing the current era to the dawn of personal computing. He advises dedicating thousands of hours to 'vibe-coding' – hands-on experimentation with AI – to gain a significant advantage in the future economy, much like early programmers did.

title: Delhi blast: 3rd terror car found; bomb squad at Al-Falah University
content: Investigators discovered a Maruti Suzuki Brezza near Al Falah University as part of the Delhi blast probe. Security sources revealed the bomber, Umar Un Nabi, planned a multi-vehicle IED attack, with three vehicles acquired for the operation. The plot, originating in Turkey, also targeted locations beyond Delhi, including Ayodhya.

title: Happy Children’s Day 2025: Best wishes, messages, quotes and images
content: Children's Day, celebrated annually on November 14th, honors the joy, curiosity, and love children bring. This year, in 2025, the occasion serves as a reminder to cherish childhood and nurture young dreams. The article offers heartfelt wishes and messages to celebrate every child's uniqueness and the special spirit of this day.

title: Red Fort blast probe: Dr Adil’s Srinagar-Delhi flight traced; ticket recovered
content: A flight ticket found in Saharanpur links Dr. Adil Ahmad, arrested last week, to a Srinagar-Delhi trip just before the Red Fort blast. The Jammu and Kashmir native, a qualified doctor, is under scrutiny for potential ties to terror outfits like Jaish-e-Mohammed. Investigators are probing his movements and contacts in Delhi.

title: Ishan Kishan to Mumbai Indians? Ex-India player’s bold statement stirs fans
content: Ishan Kishan's IPL 2025 campaign saw a strong start but a subsequent dip in form for Sunrisers Hyderabad. Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif suggests Kishan's struggles stem from batting at number three, advocating for a return to Mumbai Indians where he can open. This move, Kaif believes, would benefit both the player and MI.

title: IPL: Top 10 players who might be released; 2026 retention deadline inches closer
content: IPL 2026 retention deadline approaches, with teams finalizing squads by November 15. A blockbuster trade involving Sanju Samson, Ravindra Jadeja, and Sam Curran has already been reported. Several high-profile players, including Mohammed Shami, Venkatesh Iyer, and Deepak Chahar, are among the top 10 potentially facing release due to form, injury, or cost.

title: 'Will call it blast': Cong slams Centre over delay in 'terror' tag; seeks all-party meet
content: Congress leader Pawan Khera has criticized the government for its delayed response to the Delhi car blast near Red Fort, questioning national security and intelligence failures. He highlighted the 48-hour delay in classifying the incident as a terrorist act, which claimed 13 lives. Khera urged an All-Party Meeting to address security concerns, drawing parallels to the 2001 Parliament attack and emphasizing the need for accountability.

title: Codename 'Ukasa': Turkiye handler directed Delhi terror module; how bomber's 2022 trip became key
content: A Turkiye-based handler, codenamed Ukasa, allegedly directed a terror module led by Al-Falah University professor Umar Un Nabi in a plot hatched in 2022. The group, linked to JeM and AGuH, planned spectacular attacks in India, including at Red Fort and Ayodhya, using vehicle-borne IEDs and explosives.

title: Delhi blast: AAP claims 'new plaster, costume' for victim before PM visit; BJP fumes
content: BJP Delhi refuted AAP's claims of fabricating Prime Minister Modi and Chief Minister Gupta meeting the same patient in different conditions. BJP clarified that the CM met the patient immediately after the incident, while the PM visited after the patient had received treatment, calling AAP's allegations 'dirty politics'.

title: Matthew and Brady Tkachuk launch ‘Wingmen’ podcast, join NHL trend
content: NHL stars Matthew and Brady Tkachuk have launched their new podcast, 'Wingmen,' in partnership with Wave Sports & Entertainment. The weekly show promises candid off-ice stories and behind-the-scenes insights from two of the league's most prominent personalities. This initiative aims to provide a much-needed player-driven platform for fans to connect with the sport's stars.

title: Runs, rhythm and form: Cheteshwar Pujara's 'age' warning for Rohit, Virat
content: Former India cricketer Cheteshwar Pujara believes every bilateral series is crucial for veterans Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma as they target the 2027 ODI World Cup. Playing exclusively in ODIs presents challenges in maintaining form during breaks, making consistent performance vital for their continued selection and success. Kohli and Rohit, recently played in the ODI series in Australia,.

title: CISCE releases timetable for ICSE and ISC exams: Check schedule
content: The CISCE has announced the 2026 board exam timetables for ICSE and ISC students. Class 12 exams commence February 12, with Class 10 starting February 17. Over 4 lakh students will participate across numerous subjects. The detailed schedules offer ample preparation time, with results anticipated in April-May 2026. Students are urged to arrive early and utilize reading time effectively.

title: Arjun Tendulkar likely to get new home; Shardul Thakur set for Mumbai Indians move
content: Shardul Thakur is reportedly set for a Mumbai Indians homecoming in the upcoming IPL season, with Lucknow Super Giants in advanced talks for a deal. Simultaneously, Arjun Tendulkar is also nearing a move away from Mumbai Indians to LSG. Both transfers are expected to be straight, all-cash deals, finalized before the BCCI's official announcement.

title: Watch: Botswana hands over 8 cheetahs to President Droupadi Murmu; India's count up to 35
content: Botswana has gifted eight cheetahs to India, bolstering the nation's ambitious Project Cheetah. President Droupadi Murmu accepted the animals, a mix of adults and sub-adults, at Mokolodi Nature Reserve. These majestic cats will soon join others at Kuno National Park, aiding the restoration of the species in its historic Indian homeland. This initiative underscores a shared commitment to wildlife conservation.

title: 'He'll be perfect for them': Ex-CSK batter names surprise star to solve GT's troubles
content: Former CSK batter Anirudha Srikkanth suggests that this KKR batter could solve Gujarat Titans' middle-order woes for IPL 2026. Despite a tough 2025, the batter's past success makes him an ideal No. 4. This move addresses GT's over-reliance on their top order, a concern also noted by Matthew Hayden, as the team eyes key auction adjustments.

title: ISI-Pak terror module busted in Punjab: Grenade attack foiled; 10 held
content: Ludhiana Police have apprehended ten individuals linked to an ISI-backed grenade attack plot targeting a crowded Punjab locale. Investigations reveal foreign handlers in Pakistan, with coordination routed through three operatives in Malaysia for grenade delivery. This operation aims to disrupt cross-border terror networks and maintain state peace, thwarting a significant threat.

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal shines; check 24K, 22K city wise rates
content: Gold and silver prices surged on Thursday, buoyed by positive global sentiment and renewed safe-haven demand following the US government shutdown's end. Both precious metals saw significant gains on the MCX and in international markets. Analysts point to increased investor confidence in potential Federal Reserve easing and the US designating metals as critical as drivers for this rally.

title: Migraine is world’s second-most disabling condition, not just a bad headache
content: Migraine, a debilitating neurological disorder affecting over a billion globally, is far more than a headache. It involves complex brain changes, leading to intense pain and sensory hypersensitivity. Triggers vary, but understanding them and adopting preventive strategies like lifestyle changes and new therapies can significantly reduce attack frequency and improve lives.

title: Stephen A Smith sparks ESPN debate amid gaming app lawsuit probe
content: ESPN has reportedly asked several personalities to stop promoting Papaya Gaming. This action follows a lawsuit against the company. However, Stephen A. Smith's own promotion of the same game has not been affected. Other ESPN names like Mina Kimes have acknowledged the situation. This has sparked debate about fairness in sports media.

title: MS Dhoni's IPL 2026 plans: Gym, swimming, 2 hrs of power-hitting - 'Just Mahi things'
content: MS Dhoni is training rigorously in Ranchi to stay match-ready for IPL 2026. The 44-year-old spends nearly five hours daily at the JSCA Stadium — gym, nets, and swimming. Despite CSK’s poor IPL 2025 campaign, CEO Kasi Viswanathan has all but confirmed that Dhoni isn’t retiring, even as Sanju Samson is set to join the squad

title: Josh Allen’s wife Hailee Steinfeld supports co-star Miles Caton as Sinners scores Grammy nods
content: Hailee Steinfeld is celebrating a significant week. Her film Sinners received multiple Grammy nominations. This marks a new career achievement for the actress and singer. Steinfeld also discussed her growing enjoyment of golf. She shared her thoughts on the sport in her newsletter. Steinfeld finds the game fun and relaxing. She encourages others to embrace golf's enjoyable aspects.

title: No major impact of Trump tariffs? Moody’s says India to be fastest growing major economy
content: India will be the fastest growing major global economy, with Moody's forecasting a strong 6.5% expansion through 2027. This resilience comes despite US tariffs, as Indian exporters successfully diversify markets.

title: Kalyani Priyadarshan on her biggest lesson from father Priyadarshan: 'I will never allow anyone to call me lazy'
content: In the wake of 'Lokah: Chapter 1- Chandra's' sensational success, Kalyani Priyadarshan reflects on the invaluable lessons imparted by her father, renowned filmmaker Priyadarshan. She recounts how his relentless pursuit of excellence persisting through health challenges ignited her passion and discipline in the industry.His next film is going to be Bhoot Bangla with Akshay Kumar, Tabu and Paresh Rawal.

title: 'No job is safe anymore,' shares laid-off Amazon employee: 6 ways to future-proof your career in an age of AI layoffs
content: Amazon's job cuts highlight a new reality for professionals.  Artificial intelligence is reshaping industries, making even skilled roles vulnerable.  To thrive, workers must embrace change, develop uniquely human skills like empathy and creativity, and build strong professional networks.  Continuous learning and staying informed about technological shifts are crucial for career survival and growth in this evolving landscape.

title: IND vs SA: 'Not many bowlers ...' - Captain Gill breaks silence on Shami's omission
content: Captain Shubman Gill admitted leaving out Mohammad Shami for the South Africa Test series was a tough call, praising the veteran's class despite selecting a younger pace attack. Gill also discussed managing his captaincy workload across formats, acknowledging the mental challenge. He stressed India must be at their best against the strong South African side in the crucial WTC race.

title: Dharmendra has a 100 acre farmhouse where he spends time with first wife
content: Veteran actor Dharmendra finds solace and joy at his sprawling 100-acre farmhouse, a peaceful retreat far from Mumbai's hustle. Embracing simplicity, he cultivates fruits, vegetables, and rice, cherishing his deep connection to farming. This natural haven, where he often spends time with his wife Prakash Kaur, reflects his lifelong love for the outdoors and the land.

title: Olympic legend Surya Bonaly loses all her medals to Las Vegas thieves while caring for her cancer-stricken mother
content: Olympic figure skater Surya Bonaly is devastated after thieves stole all her career medals while she was in Minnesota caring for her mother, who is also battling cancer. The burglary at her Las Vegas home revealed broken windows and destroyed security cameras, with surveillance footage indicating multiple individuals were involved over several days.

title: Bloodshed at Maharashtra wedding: Groom stabbed on stage; drone captures assault
content: A wedding in Amravati turned violent when a man, identified as Raghav alias Ragho Jitendra Bakshi, stabbed groom Sujal Samudre (22) on stage. The shocking incident, captured by a drone, left guests in panic. While the groom is stable, the motive is suspected to be a dispute over DJ payment, leading to retaliatory vandalism at the accused's home.

title: Is Nina Lin attending the Streamer Awards? Status unclear amid assault controversy
content: Banned streamer Nina Lin expressed uncertainty about attending the Streamer Awards due to her Twitch suspension following a misconduct scandal. During a livestream with Wendy Ortiz, Lin felt she wouldn't be invited. Ortiz defended her, highlighting perceived double standards in the community. The exchange sparked debate on accountability and platform fairness.

title: Trump tariffs: Will Export Promotion Mission be able to counter impact? Top challenges
content: India's new Export Promotion Mission, approved with ₹25,060 crore over six years, aims to boost exports by supporting MSMEs and offering non-financial aid. However, experts warn of implementation delays due to its conceptual stage, pending digital platforms, and insufficient annual funding. Effective execution hinges on interdepartmental coordination and more resources.

title: Islamabad blast aftermath: PCB moves entire tri-series to Rawalpindi amid tight security
content: Pakistan's T20 tri-series against Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe will now be entirely held in Rawalpindi due to security concerns following a recent bombing. The tournament kicks off November 18th, with all matches starting at 6 pm. Sri Lanka's team will remain in Pakistan, with assurances of high-level security provided by the PCB chairman.

title: Why is NEET PG counselling 2025 delayed? A familiar cycle of disruption returns
content: Thousands of doctors face unemployment as NEET PG 2025 counselling is indefinitely postponed. This delay, attributed to seat matrix revisions and withdrawn seats, creates a critical workforce vacuum in hospitals, straining services. The situation highlights a recurring pattern of administrative and legal disruptions impacting postgraduate medical admissions since 2019, leaving students and institutions in prolonged uncertainty.

title: Stephen Curry’s sweet reply to wife Ayesha after divorce rumours
content: Divorce rumors surrounding Stephen and Ayesha Curry have been fueled by viral podcast clips. However, the couple has publicly dismissed these speculations with heartfelt Instagram posts. Ayesha's candid remarks about her evolving views on marriage and motherhood sparked online debate, with fans divided over her statements and their potential impact on the family's image.

title: Kanahiya Kumar: The Man Who Has Seen It All From Bihar To Tihar
content: In 2021, he joined the Congress and was appointed National In-Charge of the National Students' Union of India (NSUI) and became a member of the Congress Working Committee (CWC).

title: 'Husband Hit Me On Head With Set-Top Box': Popular Kerala Relationship Coach
content: A relationship coach from Kerala has accused her husband, also a popular influencer, of physically assaulting her.

title: Video: Angered By Honking, Bengaluru Man Runs Over Family Of 3 On Scooter
content: Police have arrested man who rammed into a two-wheeler carrying a family of three in Bengaluru with his car and drove off.

title: Rabri Devi: Bihar's Only Woman Chief Minister Who Got There Accidentally
content: Rabri Devi's political journey began unexpectedly. In 1997, she was sworn in as the first woman Chief Minister of Bihar after Lalu Yadav had to step down following corruption charges in the fodder scam.

title: 'Paltu Ram' Or Survivor In Chief? Nitish Kumar's Long Political Innings
content: It's election results time in Bihar, and if there's one man the country has its eyes set on, it is Nitish Kumar. Once called the architect of Bihar's development, his leadership has been under intense scrutiny amid shifting alliances and a resurgent

title: Will Bihar Choose Nitish Kumar Or Tejashwi Yadav? Counting Of Votes On Friday
content: People of Bihar wait with bated breath for Friday's counting of votes polled in the recent assembly elections, which will decide whether JD(U) supremo Nitish Kumar will get a record fifth term or whether a change in government will be witnessed.

title: Bangladesh To Hold Referendum Along With Elections In February
content: In a move that is likely to see opposition in Bangladesh, the Chief Advisor of the Interim Government of Bangladesh, Muhammad Yunus, has announced a referendum along with elections in Bangladesh in February next year.

title: Prashant Kishor's Journey From Political Strategist To Active Participant
content: Over a decade after he scripted a memorable victory in the 2014 general elections for the BJP and Narendra Modi, Prashant Kishor is back in the game.

title: Terror Suspect Was In Touch With Pulwama Attack Mastermind's Wife: Sources
content: In a big revelation, investigators probing the Jaish-e-Mohammed link in the Delhi blast and Faridabad explosives haul have found that Dr Shaheen Saeed was in touch with Afirah Bibi, the wife of Jaish commander and Pulwama mastermind Umar Farooq

title: Night Inside Car At Dhaba, Then Spotted On 50 CCTVs: How Delhi Bomber Moved
content: The Delhi Police and central investigating agencies have pieced together the final 48 hours of Dr Umar Nabi's movements before the deadly explosion outside Delhi's Red Fort on Monday evening.

title: From Cricket To Politics, 5 Facts About Tejashwi Yadav
content: Years before he entered politics, Tejashwi Yadav, the former Deputy Chief Minister of Bihar, was a budding cricketer who plied his trade for Jharkhand in domestic cricket and Delhi Daredevils in the Indian Premier League (IPL).

title: Jitan Ram Manjhi: Mahadalit Leader Who Once Defied Nitish Kumar
content: Jitan Ram Manjhi belongs to the Musahar community, part of the Mahadalits who have faced severe socio-economic discrimination.

title: Supreme Court's 'Ban Luxury Cars' Tip For Promoting Electric Vehicles
content: Phasing out luxury petrol and diesel cars could be the starting point for a proper implementation of the Centre's plans to promote Electric Vehicles (EVs), the Supreme Court said today.

title: "Why Apprehensive": Top Court Questions Tamil Nadu On SIR, Gives Notice To Poll Body
content: An exasperated Supreme Court questioned today why the critics of the voter roll revision exercise are so "apprehensive" about it.

title: Opinion: Opinion | As Terror Strikes Delhi, A Curious 'Takeover' Is Under Way In Pakistan
content: With a car bomb in Islamabad following hot on the heels of the Delhi car explosion, it seems like it's back to the future. This time, however, there may be a different set of rules operating.

title: Supreme Court's "Permanent Damage" Warning As Delhi Pollution Worsens
content: As toxic air chokes Delhi and the Air Quality Index remains in the 'severe' category, the Supreme Court today sounded an alarm, saying that the "situation is very serious" and that masks are not sufficient to protect residents' health.

title: "Pak Ready For Two-Front War": Khawaja Asif's Latest Provocation Against India
content: In yet another cross-border provocation, Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif has claimed Islamabad is fully prepared" for a two-front war with India and Afghanistan.

title: Unrest In Bangladesh As Dhaka Court Sets Hasina's Trial Verdict For November 17
content: The Muhammad Yunus regime in Bangladesh is not happy with New Delhi permitting the former Prime Minister, Sheikh Hasina, to freely interact with the media.

title: "Not Every Kashmiri Muslim Is Terrorist": Omar Abdullah After Delhi Blast
content: Not every Kashmiri Muslim is a terrorist, Chief Minister Omar Abdullah has asserted, anticipating discrimination against people from the Union territory amid a probe into the blast that ripped through the heart of Delhi earlier this week.

title: OpenAI Launches ChatGPT GPT 5.1, Makes AI Conversations More Human-Like
content: The latest model also uses less technical jargon and avoids vague or undefined terms that might confuse readers.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in? Who's out? Who's close after the second ranking?
content: a big winner might have been the entire state of Texas . the no. 3 Aggies are still in a first-round bye position . no. 15 Miami regained its position as the committee's top ACC team .

title: CFP rankings release: See the second top 25 and bracket
content: the college football playoff committee will release its rankings each Tuesday through the end of the regular season . the final set of rankings will be released on Dec. 7 and those rankings will determine the final 12-team bracket . based on the CFP top 25 .

title: Five things that have made Patriots QB Drake Maye an MVP favorite
content: new England Patriots quarterback Drake Maye has made plenty of highlight-reel plays this season . he is the favorite to win the NFL's Most Valuable Player Award . maye has called the play 11 times this season for minus-13 yar .

title: UWCL talking points: What's wrong with Arsenal? Was Earps upstaged?
content: UEFA women's champions league (UWCL) saw more exciting matchups . OL Lyonnes beat VfL Wolfsburg 3-1, real madrid thrashed st. pölten 6-0 . the match saw a 3-2 comeback win over arsenal and a 1-1 draw .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: the blackout affects ABC, the ESPN networks, the Disney-branded channels, Freeform, the FX networks and the Xfinity network . the conflict affects the channel's ability to carry Disney programming . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services including Cox, Dish, DirecTV, Fios, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, Mediacom, Optimum, Sling, Spectrum TV and

title: 🏈 Bottom 10: BYU makes dreaded appearance!
content: the red Raiders take over deep in BYU territory after a muffed punt by Parker Kingston . "It's Getting Real in the Whole Foods parking lot," DJ Spider Here at Bottom 10 Headquarters . the calendar hangs on the front of our refrigerator .

title: Women's Power Rankings: The 16 best teams so far
content: the first edition of ESPN's women's college basketball Power Rankings for 2025-26 . the top four teams in our initial rankings are the programs that went to the Final Four last season . of that group, UCLA has the most impressive victory so far: 73-59 over fellow top-10 team Oklahoma on Monday .

title: Reranking all 68 Power 4 QBs: Who rose and who fell after two months
content: a new app lets you watch your favorite events in the newly enhanced ESPN App . the new app will help you figure out who the best quarterbacks will be in a given season . it's a good idea of this year's hierarchy with just three regular-season Saturdays to go .

title: Week 12 preview: A wide-open ACC title race, key matchups and more
content: a slew of teams are teetering on a thin line between being in or out . this week features four ranked matchups that could shift the playoff picture dramatically . no. 9 Notre Dame's margin for error is zero as it faces a 7-2 Pittsburgh team .

title: Men's Power Rankings: Biggest early-season risers
content: 81 points between the two proving that their lack of perimeter shooting isn't much of a factor . the Crimson Tide had elite guards, but it wasn't clear whether they had the frontcourt balance to make another deep run in March .

title: Mekedatu project: Karnataka terms rejection of Tamil Nadu’s plea by Supreme Court as ‘justice to State’
content: The Deputy Chief Minister reiterates the project does not affect Tamil Nadu in any way, but benefits it

title: Kanjira gets a new, eco-friendly avatar thanks to artiste Ganesh Kumar
content: “We don’t need the skin of the endangered monitor lizard, which was traditionally used all these years. We can now achieve the same tonal quality without it,” says Chennai-based kanjira virtuoso Ganesh Kumar

title: India, Nepal sign agreement to ease movement of rail-based freight between the two nations
content: “This signing will facilitate the movement of rail-based freight between Jogbani (India) and Biratnagar (Nepal) including bulk cargo under an expanded definition,” the government said in a release.

title: State government urged to take clear stance on Draft Electricity Amendment Bill
content: Centre had asked all State governments to send their suggestions or comments within a stipulated time, however, the A.P. government has stayed silent on the issue, says  Vidyuth Viniyogadarula Aikya Vedika

title: From a garage to classrooms: How Bengaluru’s slum children found their classroom
content: Suresh Ambat’s idea to provide free education to kids from slum areas was shaped by his own experiences as a school-going kid

title: Palaniswami, Anbumani criticise DMK govt. over SC observation on Mekedatu project
content: Palaniswami terms it shocking and disappointing; Anbumani says govt. had suffered a big defeat when it came to safeguarding the rights of the State over the Cauvery

title: Delhi blast: Kanpur cardiology student held by Uttar Pradesh ATS over suspected links with arrested woman doctor
content: Dr. Mohammad Arif, a first-year DM (Cardiology) student at the State-run Ganesh Shankar Vidyarthi Memorial Medical College, was taken into custody from an undisclosed location, a senior official told PTI

title: Greenpeace report on shipwreck seeks to fix liability on MSC
content: Report exposes how the shipping company has systematically expanded its operations using ageing vessels and exploiting regulatory loopholes and flag-of- convenience practices, causing  environmental disasters in South Asia

title: Six Maoists killed in Chhattisgarh carried total bounty of ₹27 lakh; includes two top ultras
content: The six, who were gunned down in the forests of Kandulnar, and Kachlaram villages in remote pockets of Indravati National Park area, carried a total bounty of ₹27 lakh, Bijapur Superintendent of Police Jitendra Yadav says

title: Fortified-kernel consignments reach mills across Cauvery delta in Tamil Nadu
content: Loading at common agri-produce storages, trucking to mills and the blending operations that convert milled rice into fortified rice have been hit by shortage of casual workers

title: CISCE board exam for class 10 from Feb 17, class 12 from Feb 12
content: About 2.6 lakh candidates will appear for the ICSE (class X) examination while about 1.5 lakh candidates are set to take the ISC (class XII) examination this year.

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: A dyed-in-the-wool communist for over four decades to contest this election as UDF Independent
content: A former councillor who represented the then Champakkara ward of the Kochi Corporation P.V. Chandran was expelled by the CPI(M) last year and is contesting the newly delimited Vyttila ward under the UDF banner

title: Nagal should apply for visa with required materials: Chinese Foreign Ministry
content: Nagal was scheduled to travel to Chengdu to compete in the Australian Open Playoff event, which will give the regional players a main-draw entry into the 2026 Australian Open

content: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu assures of hand holding and east clearances to the European delegates in the meet

title: Delhi blast: NAAC issues show cause notice to Al Falah University over false accreditation claim
content: The National Assessment and Accreditation Council said it has noted that the university, "which is neither accredited nor applied for accreditation by NAAC”, has publicly displayed on its website that some of its colleges are NAAC-certified

content: So far, 19 Thozhi hostels equipped with state-of-the-art facilities have been established in 15 districts, benefiting 1,824 working women

content: The event aims to highlight the current status and trends of research and applications in the area of speech and music

title: SIR 2.0: All about enumeration form, draft roll, appeal against exclusion
content: The distribution and submission of enumeration forms, including online SIR form fill up in the second phase of SIR will continue till December 4 and the draft list will be published on December 9

title: Maneka Gandhi calls SC’s order on stray animals 'impractical'
content: Ms. Gandhi also questioned the lack of coordination among civic bodies, adding that compassion, not control, should guide India’s approach to animals

title: CII Summit in Andhra: Armenia looks forward to building shared future with India, says Minister Gevorg Papoyan

title: Mylapore chit fund case: Madras HC dismisses Devanathan Yadav’s plea to modify interim bail conditions

title: Ahead of polls, Kerala govt rolls out Prajwala scholarship scheme for job aspirants
content: ‘Prajwala – Connect to Work’ scholarship will provide a monthly assistance of ₹1,000 to eligible candidates, aged between 18 and 30 years, for a maximum period of 12 months

title: T.N. increases dearness allowance for government employees, teachers to 58%

content: The Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister sought punishment for those responsible for the Delhi blast but warned against harming any innocents in the process

content: There have been numerous incidents of cannulas breaking, leaving the plastic fragments inside patients’ veins

content: Airport sources said the Cessna 172 type single engine aircraft was on a training mission when it made an emergency landing due to technical reasons.

title: Bihar Assembly Election 2025: where and how to watch the results live
content: The results of the Bihar Assembly Election 2025 will be announced on November 14. Voters can track real-time counting updates and official trends on The Hindu’s live blog.

title: Techie arrested for hitting scooter carrying family of three in Bengaluru
content: The impact caused the scooter to fall on the road divider, throwing the family on to the road. The accused allegedly fled from the spot without stopping to help, police said

title: Mysuru police probe fake Facebook account linked to Kerala woman’s number used in cyberattack on K.C. Venugopal
content: Offensive post appeared from a Facebook profile which reportedly used the same mobile number linked to the complainant. The woman, who has been residing in Mysuru for years, said she has been using a phone number registered under the name of her sister, who works abroad

content: The MoU was facilitated by Dr. Mukesh Aghi, president & CEO, USISPF, and Sachit Ahuja, co-president, Tillman Global Holdings

title: Driver killed as girder collapses on pick-up van during elevated highway work in Kerala
content: According to police, accident occurred around 2.30 a.m. when workers lifted the girder and placed it on a hydraulic jack, which then skidded, causing the massive concrete beam to fall onto the pick-up van passing below

title: Cabinet decisions on exports to improve competitiveness: PM Modi
content: Union Cabinet, at a meeting chaired by Mr. Modi on November 12, 2025, approved the export promotion mission and a credit guarantee scheme for exporters
